intro: Ehretia dolichandra, commonly known as the long-fruited ehretia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces elongated, cylindrical fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
